issuetype.name: New Feature

projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
When I tried to run validate the first time I was missing the yaml module. Detect 3rd party modules missing and help users install like we do in our other scripts.

sudo easy_install pyyaml
fields.summary: Tooling: verify.py Detect Missing Python Modules. Give install instructions

comments.body:
For test when the fix is available:

* Check to see if you already have pyyaml installed by going into python and entering {{import yaml}}.
* If you get an error, then proceed to next step.  If not, that means you already have pyyaml, and you'll want to uninstall/rename it to test this.  [Enjoy that|http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1231688/how-do-i-remove-packages-installed-with-pythons-easy-install]. :)
* Go to the {{apidoc/}} folder in your {{titanium_mobile}} source folder and enter {{python validate.py}}.
* You should get a useful error message telling you you don't have pyyaml and how to install it.
Closing ticket due to time passed and irrelevance of ticket.
